content.text: I’ll quickly check reliable, up-to-date sources (major tech/news outlets and company blogs) to pull the most recent AI headlines for today, then summarize them for you with links.

Here are some **latest AI updates for today (Wednesday, February 25, 2026)** based on recent postings:

### Top headline
- **Anthropic announced it is acquiring Vercept** to improve Claude’s computer-use/agent capabilities (posted **Feb 25, 2026**).  
  Source: Anthropic Newsroom: https://www.anthropic.com/news

### Other very recent AI items (this week)
- **Anthropic updated its Responsible Scaling Policy to v3.0** (**Feb 24, 2026**).  
- **Anthropic posted work on detecting/preventing model distillation attacks** (**Feb 23, 2026**).  
- **Anthropic announced cybersecurity capability access for defenders** (**Feb 20, 2026**).  
- **Claude Sonnet 4.6 introduced** (**Feb 17, 2026**).  
  Source for all above: https://www.anthropic.com/news

### Bigger recent context
- **Anthropic disclosed a major Series G funding round** (**Feb 12, 2026**) with a very large valuation, signaling continued heavy investment in frontier AI.  
  Source: https://www.anthropic.com/news

---

If you want, I can also give you a **broader “today in AI” roundup** across OpenAI, Google DeepMind, Microsoft, Meta, xAI, NVIDIA, and major regulators (US/EU/UK) with only same-day / last-48-hours items.
